context: It's this game (Japanese) playable in US Console?
response: Yes, this game can play on the American PS3.

context: Are the chat pad and headset wireless?
response: no comes with a cord and the chat pad connect to the control pad as for the control pad yes it is wireless but ur gonna be walking around with a cord dangling around if u upgrade to the wireless headset

context: is this a base with interchangeable keyboards (to go from gaming-office use) where you flip the keyboard upside down to get a style?
response: Interchangeable - yes. You get two different keysets - one regular, one gaming (WASD keys on the left and others). The keysets have a clip on the side that you flip up to change out and flip down to lock in place. You don't flip anything upside down. Hope this answers your question.

context: Is it better than a scuf grip because i have a scuf controller with no grip ? Thanks for any help.
response: I have the pro grip on my scuf so i just cut the squid grip for the front of the controller it works great for me with no sliding on the front

context: Is this Thrustmaster compatible with PS2?
response: There is a PC/PS3 Switch on the left rear of the Thrustmaster.  For a list of Backwards Programmable compatible games to PS3 from PS2 and earlier, Wikipedia is one link to check;   http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_PlayStation_3_backward_compatible_PlayStation_2_and_PlayStation_games

context: Do these pedals have a center detent?
response: I don't know about a "detent"; they self center, and that big dial in the center is the spring tension adjustment.

context: Hi, i'd like to know if with this starter can i play with marvel characters.
response: This is the original starter and can only play with the 1.0 version characters. All the marvel character must be played on the 2.0 version software. Sorry, no marvel characters for this starter.
